N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 2§ 14.3 - Deposits of moneys in banks

State Regulations

Moneys received by any State agency for subsequent payment
into any fund in the custody of the State Treasury, and moneys received by
custodian of special funds in which the State has an interest, direct or
indirect, or under the control of the State, shall be deposited, daily if
possible, and not later than once a week, in a bank or trust company of the

State. When required by law (see State Finance Law, §§105, 106), such deposits
shall be in a depository approved by the Comptroller and shall be secured by
bonds. Moneys include cash, checks, bond coupons, etc. All such receipts shall
be deposited in a bank, and any payments therefrom, if authorized, shall be
only by check on the bank of deposit. Notes
